reviews.text: The Hampton Inn is on the outskirts of Missoula, but easily accessible from the highway. It is decorated in a very warm, high-quality style. The rooms are spacious, clean and very inviting. The staff were all super friendly and nice. The free continental breakfast did include eggs and the quality of the food was very good for this type of breakfast.
reviews.title: Clean, Modern and Warm Decor, Spacious Rooms and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I travel to Seattle often and always stay at the hampton on the way. It is always a delight. The staff is friendly and efficient and the beds are comfortable. The breakfast is well stocked and the new flat screen TVs are perfect. The price is just right for me and I will be back for sure!
reviews.title: Convenient and very friendly
Excellent service and value
reviews.text: My husband and I recently travelled across the USA and found this Hampton. The entire staff was beyond our expectations. We travel all over the world and have seldom seen such awesome service. They are so proud of their facility and they should be! It is spotless and well situated. We have a large labrador retriever - very quiet animal but were sincerley welcomed upon arrival. After eating at a local steakhouse "Montana Club" ( we had awesome prime rib) that was recommended by the ladies at the front desk, we enjoyed a very comfortable room. We would definitley go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this Hampton Inn for 3 nights, and the stay was pleasant. The room itself was small and in need of some upgrading, but the bathroom was quite large--much larger than usual. The room and bath were both clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast (free) was quite good--far superior to the usual continental. Warm cookies in the afternoon provide a nice touch. The hotel is close to the airport rather than the downtown/university area, and the road it's on experiences heavy traffic, especially during rush hours. Because of this and despite the reasonable rate, we would probably stay closer in if we ever return to Missoula.
reviews.title: Pleasant but rather far from city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was amazed with the service at the Hampton ! Great rooms, Very nice and clean pool, Great breakfast, Good parking. A must stay and must enjoy motel !!!
reviews.title: The nicest motel ever !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's obvious that the people behind this motel have experience in accommodating travelers. It's a good value because they've put all their attention on the things that are important and left out a lot of the stuff that isn't. I must concur that the beds are outstanding. The bathroom is large for the size of the room. Everything was clean and had attractive contemporary decor. The hotel is on a fairly busy street, but street sounds are muffled so that the only traffic I heard at all were faint sounds of big semis. Breakfast was better than average with bacon and eggs and fruit and a good selection of breakfast breads.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: My only complaint was that the temperature was hard to control. We finally just turned off the heat, but it was still stuffy. Maybe because we were on the 4th floor (Great view!) and heat rises.
reviews.title: A little too smoky for me...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also there was a large loud family who monopolized the pool and hot tub all evening and were loud and obnoxious in the dining area at breakfast. They brought their dog to breakfast and no one said anything to them even though we had to sign a form saying we knew we couldn't bring dogs in the dining area.
reviews.title: Still The TOP Missoula Hotel

reviews.text: Maybe I'm too sensitive, but I have a pet peeve about people in the motel breakfast areas who act like they are at home in their breakfast rooms.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I was staying for more than one night I would've walked the floors to find one that wasn't smoky or left. Disappointment...
reviews.title: The helpful, cheerful staff push this hotel over the top

reviews.text: A nice hotel I would stay here again when visiting Missoula
reviews.title: Nice Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Have stayed here several times. The staff is friendly; the rooms are clean. Breakfast is OK, but not great.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff. Nice, Clean Rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this Hampton Inn. Very comfy beds with lots of pillows made this room a welcoming sight after a day of travelling in the heat. Microwave and fridge were useful. Granite counters in a clean bathroom. I had the impression the hotel was rather new. Breakfast, which included waffles, eggs with turkey sausage, as well as cereal choices (hot and cold), breads, fruit juicesand fresh fruit like oranges, apples and grapefruit sections, impressed me. Freshly baked cookies were offered around 6:30pm and the coffee pots by the checkin counter offered refreshments for those checking in. I had a real good night's sleep. Quiet with easy access to Hi 90. We walked to Montana's for supper. Shopping malls a block or two away. WiFI was great in the room with a nice desk to work from. In the lobby I noticed some games and a small library of books as well as a large TV in case you wanted to lounge around in the lobby. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Predictably Hampton in all respects but breakfast. The breakfast was even above normal Hampton standards. This hotel is particularly convenient to "resupply" for a trip into Glacier, etc. Down Reserve Street there is an abundance of shopping, automotive services, big box stores, and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great room, great breakfast.

reviews.text: This is a very nice Hampton Inn. It is not new, but it makes up for it in a lot of ways. First and foremost, it has a creek behind it. Awesome. I had a room where I could open up the window and see the creek and slept with the window open and heard it all night. Great. The road noise was a little bad with the window open, but late at night it was silent. The rooms are standard, but the bathroom was huge, and the shower was very nice (no bathtub). I really loved the bathroom. The front desk girl who checked me in was very nice and gave the place a down home feel, perfect for Montana. Stay here.
reviews.title: Very nice Hampton Inn, do yourself a favor when in Missoula, stay here.

reviews.text: This was a pleasant stay: nice, quiet clean hotel with very nice staff. The location was handy but not particularly scenic. (My parents stayed in the Best Western across I-90, and I thought the location was a little better, but I don't know about the rooms or anything else.) The breakfast was nice in the morning, too. I would definitely stay here again. I don't know about the value or the billing, as I booked a free stay using Hilton points.
reviews.title: Good hotel, would stay again.

reviews.text: We stayed on the second floor and the elevator is a little bit slow and a little bit out of the way, so if you have mobility problems, you might want to request a first floor room. The pool was clean but nothing fancy. It is open 24 hours a day for adults.
reviews.title: Basic but great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were just spending one night here on our way home and we found it to be a very nice, basic hotel. The beds were very comfortable, quiet and dark rooms. The bathroom was enormous! We couldn't believe it. Huge marble counters and great shower. Internet access, breakfast in the morning. Would definitely stay here again. Great price and really nice clean hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, billing problem

likes.disliked: — Location away from downtown, billing hiccup

reviews.text: We were looking for someplace modest yet clean for ourselves and parents. We got a room just across from the pool, (24 hours for adults, daytime and early evening hours for children with adults,) and my folks stayed on the east side of the third floor. While there was no noise in our room, there was a bit of road noise in theirs. There appeared to be no road noise in some friends' rooms on the west side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay!

likes.liked: — The beds and the breakfast buffet

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and professional, the rooms clean, and the beds were comfortable. The WiFi worked well and parking was adequate.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hampton is well located, right off I-90, and has good size, very clean rooms. The breakfast buffet is very tasty and even the coffee is good. The gals at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. Real Montana hospitality at its best.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Missoula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I like Hampton Inn properties and this one was among the best. The facility is nicely maintained and the staff is very friendly. They must be doing something right because on both our stays the 200+ room hotel was full. Check out their AAA rate: we paid only $67.50 per night!
reviews.title: Convenient, Friendly, Great Value
Friendly staff
reviews.text: I spent one night and it was okay. Clean and quiet.
My wife and I have stayed here 3 times in the last 3 yrs, and have been extremely satisfied every time. It's the only Hampton Inn that I know of that allows small pets for a $10 fee.
reviews.title: Great hotel; pet-friendly too!

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Predictable and perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --the friendliest, nicest staff; very casual, neighborly atmosphere
reviews.title: Quiet and Comfortable

reviews.text: --very clean, well-maintained property
reviews.title: disappointed.beds were terrible.cost was high

reviews.text: --great location right off Interstate 90
reviews.title: New, clean and friendly
